dismissalText.commentary: Thisara Perera not out 80 (57b 4x4 6x6 84m) SR: 140.35
Sachithra Senanayake b Shakib Al Hasan 30 (48b 2x4 1x6 54m) SR: 62.5

dismissalComment.html: and the stand has been broken! Senanayake came down the track to go over the top but missed it completely and had his stumps shattered

headshotImage.caption: Ashan Priyanjan player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ashan Priyanjan player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: and Shakib strikes in his first over! Pitched it on length from wide of the crease and aiming for the off stump, Priyanjan went back to cut but missed it completely and the umpire raised his finger. Not sure if it hit him in line of the off stump, was very very close
and the stand has been broken! Senanayake came down the track to go over the top but missed it completely and had his stumps shattered
and Dilshan falls under pressure! It was a short delivery and coming in, Dilshan pulled but didn't time it properly and got a leading edge to midwicket where Mushfiqur Rahim took an easy catch

headshotImage.caption: Kusal Perera player page headshot cutout 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Kusal Perera player page headshot cutout 2021

dismissalComment.html: and the angle works! Rubel bowled it full, not giving Perera any room, Perera wanted to put it away on the leg side but didn't get any bat and the ball trapped him in front of leg stump. Didn't look plumb, it might have missed the leg stump

dismissalText.long: c Mushfiqur Rahim b Rubel Hossain
dismissalText.commentary: Tillakaratne Dilshan c Mushfiqur Rahim b Rubel Hossain 3 (11b 0x4 0x6 20m) SR: 27.27

dismissalComment.html: and Dilshan falls under pressure! It was a short delivery and coming in, Dilshan pulled but didn't time it properly and got a leading edge to midwicket where Mushfiqur Rahim took an easy catch

headshotImage.caption: Kusal Perera player page headshot cutout 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Kusal Perera player page headshot cutout 2021

headshotImage.caption: Kusal Perera player page headshot cutout 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Kusal Perera player page headshot cutout 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Kusal Perera lbw b Rubel Hossain 20 (18b 2x4 1x6 28m) SR: 111.11

dismissalComment.html: and the angle works! Rubel bowled it full, not giving Perera any room, Perera wanted to put it away on the leg side but didn't get any bat and the ball trapped him in front of leg stump. Didn't look plumb, it might have missed the leg stump

dismissalText.long: c Arafat Sunny b Al-Amin Hossain
dismissalText.commentary: Kumar Sangakkara c Arafat Sunny b Al-Amin Hossain 8 (14b 1x4 0x6 30m) SR: 57.14

dismissalComment.html: Sanga is gone too and what a huge wicket for the debutant! Al-Amin pitched it up on the stumps, Sanga came down the track to loft it over the mid-off fielder but couldn't time it and Arafat Sunny takes a good catch over his head

headshotImage.caption: Ashan Priyanjan player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ashan Priyanjan player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Ashan Priyanjan player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ashan Priyanjan player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Ashan Priyanjan lbw b Shakib Al Hasan 6 (8b 1x4 0x6 9m) SR: 75

dismissalComment.html: and Shakib strikes in his first over! Pitched it on length from wide of the crease and aiming for the off stump, Priyanjan went back to cut but missed it completely and the umpire raised his finger. Not sure if it hit him in line of the off stump, was very very close

headshotImage.caption: Dinesh Chandimal, player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Dinesh Chandimal, player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Dinesh Chandimal, player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Dinesh Chandimal, player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Dinesh Chandimal run out (Shakib Al Hasan/Arafat Sunny) 13 (28b 0x4 0x6 43m) SR: 46.42

dismissalComment.html: oh there's a mix up and Chandimal is run out! What an effort from Shakib there - Chandimal drove the length ball towards cover point and set off for the single but Shakib dived full length to his left and threw it to Arafat Sunny at the non-striker's end and Chandimal was nowhere close to the crease

headshotImage.caption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023
headshotImage.longCaption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023

headshotImage.caption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023
headshotImage.longCaption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023

dismissalText.commentary: Angelo Mathews b Arafat Sunny 3 (15b 0x4 0x6 16m) SR: 20

dismissalComment.html: this debutant is no less, what a delivery! Arafat pitched it on length outside off and ithe flat delivery came in a bit, going through the big gap between Mathews' bat and pad to hit the off stump. Anamul Haque roars behind the stumps, Arafut Sunny has his arms in the air

dismissalText.commentary: Nuwan Kulasekara b Arafat Sunny 0 (9b 0x4 0x6 6m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: oh and one more, what's happening here! This one very similar to Mathews' dismissal - pitched outside off and it came in with the angle, going through the defence of Kulasekara to hit top of off stump and Anamul roars again!

headshotImage.caption: Kithuruwan Vithanage player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Kithuruwan Vithanage player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Kithuruwan Vithanage player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Kithuruwan Vithanage player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Sohag Gazi  player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Sohag Gazi  player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Kithuruwan Vithanage run out (Mushfiqur Rahim) 7 (22b 1x4 0x6 22m) SR: 31.81

dismissalComment.html: that's a close call for a run out! Vithanage pushed the ball from leg stump to mid-on for a cheeky single and set off early but a sharp and flat throw from mid-on catches Vithanage just short of his crease

dismissalText.commentary: Sachithra Senanayake b Shakib Al Hasan 30 (48b 2x4 1x6 54m) SR: 62.5

dismissalComment.html: and the stand has been broken! Senanayake came down the track to go over the top but missed it completely and had his stumps shattered

headshotImage.caption: Sohag Gazi  player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Sohag Gazi  player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.long: c Anamul Haque b Sohag Gazi
dismissalText.commentary: Lasith Malinga c Anamul Haque b Sohag Gazi 0 (10b 0x4 0x6 19m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: and he's gone, it is finally all over! Gazi pitched this on length outside off, Malinga poked and got an outside edge and Anamul took a good catch behind the stumps

headshotImage.caption: Shamsur Rahman player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Shamsur Rahman  player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Shamsur Rahman player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Shamsur Rahman  player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Shamsur Rahman run out (Malinga/Sangakkara) 62 (49b 5x4 3x6 99m) SR: 126.53

dismissalComment.html: that's gone high in the air but it's beyond Malinga's reach. Shamsur heaved and the leading edge went beyond the reach of mid-off fielder. But wait, Sangakkara has appealed for a run out because Shamsur's bat got stuck just before he made it to the crease for the second run and Sanga took the bails off. Shamsur had crossed the crease but his feet are in the air, very hard to call if he was out of the crease for sure. The third umpire has to make a call though and he calls it out

dismissalText.commentary: Mominul Haque c Dilshan b NLTC Perera 44 (53b 7x4 0x6 69m) SR: 83.01

dismissalComment.html: oh he has handed it straight to point! Got more room to free his arms outside off, cut it straight into the hands of Dilshan as he failed to find the gap this time

headshotImage.caption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023
headshotImage.longCaption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023

headshotImage.caption: Sohag Gazi  player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Sohag Gazi  player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: and another one falls, Bangladesh are crumbling here! Gazi went for a wild slog for a ball that was coming in and got a leading edge to the cover region and Vithanage ran back towards the boundary to take a very good catch
Mathews strikes now, another twist in the tail. Mathews angled it across, Sunny drove away from the body and got a faint edge which was taken by Sanga easily

oh Mushfiqur is gone! Mathews pitched this one outside off on length but Mushfiqur went across completely, looking to scoop it fine on the leg side but only manages an edge down leg to the keeper. That's the big wicket SL wanted

Senanayake strikes after building a lot of pressure, het gets Nasir. It was a conventional and flighted offspinner outside off, Nasir stepped forward to drive and handed an edge to Mathews to first slip
oh and one more, now we know why the short leg fielder was there! Mahmudullah played the ball with the turn to the leg side and it went straight to Priyanjan at short leg, he's gone for a duck

headshotImage.caption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023
headshotImage.longCaption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023

dismissalText.commentary: Anamul Haque c Mathews b Malinga 0 (2b 0x4 0x6 2m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: oh that's dropped, no it's taken, and how! Anamul edged the ball outside off straight to second slip where Senanayake dropped it and the ball was going to fall in front of first slip Mathews who jumped forward to got both hands under the ball and Bangladesh are 0 for 1

dismissalText.commentary: Mominul Haque c Dilshan b NLTC Perera 44 (53b 7x4 0x6 69m) SR: 83.01

dismissalComment.html: oh he has handed it straight to point! Got more room to free his arms outside off, cut it straight into the hands of Dilshan as he failed to find the gap this time

dismissalText.commentary: Shamsur Rahman run out (Malinga/Sangakkara) 62 (49b 5x4 3x6 99m) SR: 126.53

dismissalComment.html: that's gone high in the air but it's beyond Malinga's reach. Shamsur heaved and the leading edge went beyond the reach of mid-off fielder. But wait, Sangakkara has appealed for a run out because Shamsur's bat got stuck just before he made it to the crease for the second run and Sanga took the bails off. Shamsur had crossed the crease but his feet are in the air, very hard to call if he was out of the crease for sure. The third umpire has to make a call though and he calls it out

dismissalText.commentary: Shakib Al Hasan run out (Malinga/Sangakkara) 3 (9b 0x4 0x6 10m) SR: 33.33

dismissalComment.html: oh and another run out chance, or has he made it? Shafiq pushed the ball to point and wanted the single but a flat throw from an agile Malinga helped Sanga take the bails off just in time and a diving Shakib could not make it, he has to go back

headshotImage.caption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023
headshotImage.longCaption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023

dismissalText.commentary: Nasir Hossain c Mathews b Senanayake 8 (29b 1x4 0x6 25m) SR: 27.58

dismissalComment.html: Senanayake strikes after building a lot of pressure, het gets Nasir. It was a conventional and flighted offspinner outside off, Nasir stepped forward to drive and handed an edge to Mathews to first slip

headshotImage.caption: Ashan Priyanjan player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ashan Priyanjan player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Mahmudullah c Priyanjan b Senanayake 0 (2b 0x4 0x6 1m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: oh and one more, now we know why the short leg fielder was there! Mahmudullah played the ball with the turn to the leg side and it went straight to Priyanjan at short leg, he's gone for a duck

dismissalText.commentary: Mushfiqur Rahim c Sangakkara b Mathews 27 (50b 0x4 1x6 110m) SR: 54

dismissalComment.html: oh Mushfiqur is gone! Mathews pitched this one outside off on length but Mushfiqur went across completely, looking to scoop it fine on the leg side but only manages an edge down leg to the keeper. That's the big wicket SL wanted

headshotImage.longCaption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023

headshotImage.caption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023
headshotImage.longCaption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023

dismissalText.commentary: Rubel Hossain run out (Senanayake/Mathews) 4 (16b 0x4 0x6 21m) SR: 25

dismissalComment.html: there's a mix-up and it's all over for Bangladesh! Rubel clipped the ball to midwicket and they set off for a single but Rubel hesitated and it was too late by then. Al-Amin had crossed him and Rubel ran towards the non-striker's end but Mathews had taken the bails off by then

batsmen.shot: on side drive on front foot

headshotImage.caption: Shamsur Rahman player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Shamsur Rahman  player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023
headshotImage.longCaption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023

dismissalText.commentary: Rubel Hossain run out (Senanayake/Mathews) 4 (16b 0x4 0x6 21m) SR: 25

commentTextItems.html: there's a mix-up and it's all over for Bangladesh! Rubel clipped the ball to midwicket and they set off for a single but Rubel hesitated and it was too late by then. Al-Amin had crossed him and Rubel ran towards the non-striker's end but Mathews had taken the bails off by then

commentPostTextItems.html: 9.25pm Bangladesh come close again but can't go all the way. Sri Lanka were in deep trouble at 67 for 8 after they were put in to bat, struggling to get to 100, but an unbeaten fifty from Thisara Perera charged them to a respectable 180. Bangladesh started very well with the help of Shamsur and Mominul but once the former was run out, Senanayake built a lot of pressure and took two quick wickets which were followed by the remaining four wickets and SL snatched a victory from the hosts. A 13-run win puts SL in the lead of the three-match series.
Tarik: "67 was required with 8 wickets left when Shamsur was dismissed. Srilanka was 67 when the 8th wicket fell. And now all out for 167. The number 67 played a crucial role today!"

Mushfiqur Rahim: Those catches were important and Thisara Perera attacked very well later. 180 was chasable and we lost early wickets but Shamsur and Mominul batted well initially. In the last T20 also we had a chance to win and it happened today again, so we need to find out what to do to win because the second ODI is only two days away. Perera batted bell with Senanayake, silly run outs and catches made the difference. We can't play 30 overs really well and let off in the later 20 matches. We need to play well throughout the game.

Angelo Mathews: Credit goes to Bangladesh, the way they bowled and took some brilliant wickets. Thisara batted very positively with Senanayake and took us forward. Dropped catches happen in the game, it was a good effort from them and nothing can be taken away from their effort. Wicket by wicket we slowly fought back and the way our bowlers went about the game, amazing performance form the team. Bangladesh is a strong team, especially at home, we have to improve our game.

Thisara Perera is the Man of the Match: Sachithra and I did very well for us after losing eight wickets. 180 was chasable and they were batting well, but we did well to dismiss them. Everyone supported each other very well and it was a good teamwork.

That's all we have for you today, thanks for joining us and for all the feedback during the rain and throughout this exciting match. Join us again for the second ODI, till then it's goodbye form Vishal. Goodbye!

commentTextItems.html: angled into the batsman, he clips it to the leg side for one
ends the over with a bouncer too, the batsman ducks again

headshotImage.caption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023
headshotImage.longCaption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023

commentTextItems.html: onto the pads and it's helped down the leg side fine, Thisara dives to cut it back but spills it and the ball rolls towards the boundary and he catches hold of it just in time to keep it to two runs

commentPreTextItems.html: Shohag: "Come on Rubel. Hack down your previous highest score. "

commentTextItems.html: length delivery darted towards middle stump, Rubel defends it
in the block hole outside off, Rubel blocks it
slower one towards the pads, Rubel defends it on the leg side but they decide not to go for the single
starts with a bouncer and Rubel is happy to duck under it

headshotImage.caption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023
headshotImage.longCaption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023

commentTextItems.html: length delivery outside off, pushed to cover by Al-Amin

commentPreTextItems.html: SpiderCam: "As an Indian supporter, I can completely understand how Bangladeshi supporters are feeling now.. Snatching a loss from victory's teeth"

commentTextItems.html: on the pads again, helped to fine leg for a single
fuller on the pads, flicked to deep midwicket for one
on length well outside off, Al-Amin chases and misses

dismissalText.commentary: Mushfiqur Rahim c Sangakkara b Mathews 27 (50b 0x4 1x6 110m) SR: 54

commentTextItems.html: oh Mushfiqur is gone! Mathews pitched this one outside off on length but Mushfiqur went across completely, looking to scoop it fine on the leg side but only manages an edge down leg to the keeper. That's the big wicket SL wanted

commentPreTextItems.html: Muhammad Shahid: "is it heading towards the LAST BALL WIN for Sri Lanka...!!! unlikely but possibly may be!!!"
Midwicket goes back deep and the slip moves to short midwicket, but goes back again

commentTextItems.html: full toss on middle, Rubel defends it back and it's a maiden

headshotImage.caption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023
headshotImage.longCaption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023

commentPreTextItems.html: Lekhnath: "I forgot the name but I remember, that a guy was comment about this game," target will be 180 and thriller like last T20 match :D " salute him, what a geuss"

commentTextItems.html: length ball outside off this time and Rubel shows the full face of the bat to defend it
now bowls a bouncer which Rubel ducks under
length delivery aimed at the middle stump, Rubel defends it back
a really slow and low full toss on the leg stump and Rubel defends it carefully

commentPreTextItems.html: Time for the batting Powerplay and Lasith Malinga is into the attack
James: "Don't you just love low scoring ODI's on dodgy pitches? Twist this way and that. Much more fun than a 350 score."

commentTextItems.html: attempted yorker turns into a low full toss on leg, Rubel defends it

headshotImage.longCaption: Sohag Gazi  player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.long: c Anamul Haque b Sohag Gazi
dismissalText.commentary: Lasith Malinga c Anamul Haque b Sohag Gazi 0 (10b 0x4 0x6 19m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: and he's gone, it is finally all over! Gazi pitched this on length outside off, Malinga poked and got an outside edge and Anamul took a good catch behind the stumps

Sanga is gone too and what a huge wicket for the debutant! Al-Amin pitched it up on the stumps, Sanga came down the track to loft it over the mid-off fielder but couldn't time it and Arafat Sunny takes a good catch over his head
and Dilshan falls under pressure! It was a short delivery and coming in, Dilshan pulled but didn't time it properly and got a leading edge to midwicket where Mushfiqur Rahim took an easy catch

headshotImage.caption: Kusal Perera player page headshot cutout 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Kusal Perera player page headshot cutout 2021

dismissalComment.html: and the angle works! Rubel bowled it full, not giving Perera any room, Perera wanted to put it away on the leg side but didn't get any bat and the ball trapped him in front of leg stump. Didn't look plumb, it might have missed the leg stump

headshotImage.caption: Ashan Priyanjan player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ashan Priyanjan player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: and Shakib strikes in his first over! Pitched it on length from wide of the crease and aiming for the off stump, Priyanjan went back to cut but missed it completely and the umpire raised his finger. Not sure if it hit him in line of the off stump, was very very close
and the stand has been broken! Senanayake came down the track to go over the top but missed it completely and had his stumps shattered

headshotImage.caption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023
headshotImage.longCaption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023

dismissalComment.html: this debutant is no less, what a delivery! Arafat pitched it on length outside off and ithe flat delivery came in a bit, going through the big gap between Mathews' bat and pad to hit the off stump. Anamul Haque roars behind the stumps, Arafut Sunny has his arms in the air

oh and one more, what's happening here! This one very similar to Mathews' dismissal - pitched outside off and it came in with the angle, going through the defence of Kulasekara to hit top of off stump and Anamul roars again!

headshotImage.caption: Sohag Gazi  player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Sohag Gazi  player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: and he's gone, it is finally all over! Gazi pitched this on length outside off, Malinga poked and got an outside edge and Anamul took a good catch behind the stumps

dismissalText.commentary: Tillakaratne Dilshan c Mushfiqur Rahim b Rubel Hossain 3 (11b 0x4 0x6 20m) SR: 27.27

dismissalComment.html: and Dilshan falls under pressure! It was a short delivery and coming in, Dilshan pulled but didn't time it properly and got a leading edge to midwicket where Mushfiqur Rahim took an easy catch

headshotImage.caption: Kusal Perera player page headshot cutout 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Kusal Perera player page headshot cutout 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Kusal Perera lbw b Rubel Hossain 20 (18b 2x4 1x6 28m) SR: 111.11

dismissalComment.html: and the angle works! Rubel bowled it full, not giving Perera any room, Perera wanted to put it away on the leg side but didn't get any bat and the ball trapped him in front of leg stump. Didn't look plumb, it might have missed the leg stump

dismissalText.long: c Arafat Sunny b Al-Amin Hossain
dismissalText.commentary: Kumar Sangakkara c Arafat Sunny b Al-Amin Hossain 8 (14b 1x4 0x6 30m) SR: 57.14

dismissalComment.html: Sanga is gone too and what a huge wicket for the debutant! Al-Amin pitched it up on the stumps, Sanga came down the track to loft it over the mid-off fielder but couldn't time it and Arafat Sunny takes a good catch over his head

headshotImage.caption: Ashan Priyanjan player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ashan Priyanjan player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Ashan Priyanjan player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ashan Priyanjan player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Ashan Priyanjan lbw b Shakib Al Hasan 6 (8b 1x4 0x6 9m) SR: 75

dismissalComment.html: and Shakib strikes in his first over! Pitched it on length from wide of the crease and aiming for the off stump, Priyanjan went back to cut but missed it completely and the umpire raised his finger. Not sure if it hit him in line of the off stump, was very very close

headshotImage.caption: Dinesh Chandimal, player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Dinesh Chandimal, player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Dinesh Chandimal, player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Dinesh Chandimal, player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Dinesh Chandimal run out (Shakib Al Hasan/Arafat Sunny) 13 (28b 0x4 0x6 43m) SR: 46.42

dismissalComment.html: oh there's a mix up and Chandimal is run out! What an effort from Shakib there - Chandimal drove the length ball towards cover point and set off for the single but Shakib dived full length to his left and threw it to Arafat Sunny at the non-striker's end and Chandimal was nowhere close to the crease

headshotImage.caption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023
headshotImage.longCaption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023

headshotImage.caption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023
headshotImage.longCaption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023

dismissalText.commentary: Angelo Mathews b Arafat Sunny 3 (15b 0x4 0x6 16m) SR: 20

dismissalComment.html: this debutant is no less, what a delivery! Arafat pitched it on length outside off and ithe flat delivery came in a bit, going through the big gap between Mathews' bat and pad to hit the off stump. Anamul Haque roars behind the stumps, Arafut Sunny has his arms in the air

dismissalText.commentary: Nuwan Kulasekara b Arafat Sunny 0 (9b 0x4 0x6 6m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: oh and one more, what's happening here! This one very similar to Mathews' dismissal - pitched outside off and it came in with the angle, going through the defence of Kulasekara to hit top of off stump and Anamul roars again!

headshotImage.caption: Kithuruwan Vithanage player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Kithuruwan Vithanage player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Kithuruwan Vithanage player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Kithuruwan Vithanage player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Sohag Gazi  player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Sohag Gazi  player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Kithuruwan Vithanage run out (Mushfiqur Rahim) 7 (22b 1x4 0x6 22m) SR: 31.81

dismissalComment.html: that's a close call for a run out! Vithanage pushed the ball from leg stump to mid-on for a cheeky single and set off early but a sharp and flat throw from mid-on catches Vithanage just short of his crease

dismissalText.commentary: Sachithra Senanayake b Shakib Al Hasan 30 (48b 2x4 1x6 54m) SR: 62.5

dismissalComment.html: and the stand has been broken! Senanayake came down the track to go over the top but missed it completely and had his stumps shattered

headshotImage.caption: Sohag Gazi  player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Sohag Gazi  player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.long: c Anamul Haque b Sohag Gazi
dismissalText.commentary: Lasith Malinga c Anamul Haque b Sohag Gazi 0 (10b 0x4 0x6 19m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: and he's gone, it is finally all over! Gazi pitched this on length outside off, Malinga poked and got an outside edge and Anamul took a good catch behind the stumps

headshotImage.caption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023
headshotImage.longCaption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023

dismissalText.commentary: Anamul Haque c Mathews b Malinga 0 (2b 0x4 0x6 2m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: oh that's dropped, no it's taken, and how! Anamul edged the ball outside off straight to second slip where Senanayake dropped it and the ball was going to fall in front of first slip Mathews who jumped forward to got both hands under the ball and Bangladesh are 0 for 1

headshotImage.caption: Shamsur Rahman player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Shamsur Rahman  player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Shamsur Rahman player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Shamsur Rahman  player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Shamsur Rahman run out (Malinga/Sangakkara) 62 (49b 5x4 3x6 99m) SR: 126.53

dismissalComment.html: that's gone high in the air but it's beyond Malinga's reach. Shamsur heaved and the leading edge went beyond the reach of mid-off fielder. But wait, Sangakkara has appealed for a run out because Shamsur's bat got stuck just before he made it to the crease for the second run and Sanga took the bails off. Shamsur had crossed the crease but his feet are in the air, very hard to call if he was out of the crease for sure. The third umpire has to make a call though and he calls it out

dismissalText.commentary: Mominul Haque c Dilshan b NLTC Perera 44 (53b 7x4 0x6 69m) SR: 83.01

dismissalComment.html: oh he has handed it straight to point! Got more room to free his arms outside off, cut it straight into the hands of Dilshan as he failed to find the gap this time

headshotImage.caption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023
headshotImage.longCaption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023

dismissalText.commentary: Mushfiqur Rahim c Sangakkara b Mathews 27 (50b 0x4 1x6 110m) SR: 54

dismissalComment.html: oh Mushfiqur is gone! Mathews pitched this one outside off on length but Mushfiqur went across completely, looking to scoop it fine on the leg side but only manages an edge down leg to the keeper. That's the big wicket SL wanted

dismissalText.commentary: Shakib Al Hasan run out (Malinga/Sangakkara) 3 (9b 0x4 0x6 10m) SR: 33.33

dismissalComment.html: oh and another run out chance, or has he made it? Shafiq pushed the ball to point and wanted the single but a flat throw from an agile Malinga helped Sanga take the bails off just in time and a diving Shakib could not make it, he has to go back

headshotImage.caption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023
headshotImage.longCaption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023

dismissalText.commentary: Nasir Hossain c Mathews b Senanayake 8 (29b 1x4 0x6 25m) SR: 27.58

dismissalComment.html: Senanayake strikes after building a lot of pressure, het gets Nasir. It was a conventional and flighted offspinner outside off, Nasir stepped forward to drive and handed an edge to Mathews to first slip

headshotImage.caption: Ashan Priyanjan player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ashan Priyanjan player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Mahmudullah c Priyanjan b Senanayake 0 (2b 0x4 0x6 1m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: oh and one more, now we know why the short leg fielder was there! Mahmudullah played the ball with the turn to the leg side and it went straight to Priyanjan at short leg, he's gone for a duck

headshotImage.caption: Sohag Gazi  player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Sohag Gazi  player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Sohag Gazi  player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Sohag Gazi  player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023
headshotImage.longCaption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023

headshotImage.caption: Kithuruwan Vithanage player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Kithuruwan Vithanage player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Sohag Gazi c Vithanage b Mathews 6 (9b 1x4 0x6 13m) SR: 66.66

dismissalComment.html: and another one falls, Bangladesh are crumbling here! Gazi went for a wild slog for a ball that was coming in and got a leading edge to the cover region and Vithanage ran back towards the boundary to take a very good catch

headshotImage.caption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023
headshotImage.longCaption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023

dismissalText.commentary: Arafat Sunny c Sangakkara b Mathews 5 (13b 1x4 0x6 20m) SR: 38.46

dismissalComment.html: Mathews strikes now, another twist in the tail. Mathews angled it across, Sunny drove away from the body and got a faint edge which was taken by Sanga easily

headshotImage.caption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023
headshotImage.longCaption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023

headshotImage.caption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023
headshotImage.longCaption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023

dismissalText.commentary: Rubel Hossain run out (Senanayake/Mathews) 4 (16b 0x4 0x6 21m) SR: 25

dismissalComment.html: there's a mix-up and it's all over for Bangladesh! Rubel clipped the ball to midwicket and they set off for a single but Rubel hesitated and it was too late by then. Al-Amin had crossed him and Rubel ran towards the non-striker's end but Mathews had taken the bails off by then

dismissalText.commentary: Al-Amin Hossain not out 2 (5b 0x4 0x6 11m) SR: 40

dismissalComment.html: oh that's dropped, no it's taken, and how! Anamul edged the ball outside off straight to second slip where Senanayake dropped it and the ball was going to fall in front of first slip Mathews who jumped forward to got both hands under the ball and Bangladesh are 0 for 1

dismissalComment.html: and another one falls, Bangladesh are crumbling here! Gazi went for a wild slog for a ball that was coming in and got a leading edge to the cover region and Vithanage ran back towards the boundary to take a very good catch
Mathews strikes now, another twist in the tail. Mathews angled it across, Sunny drove away from the body and got a faint edge which was taken by Sanga easily

oh Mushfiqur is gone! Mathews pitched this one outside off on length but Mushfiqur went across completely, looking to scoop it fine on the leg side but only manages an edge down leg to the keeper. That's the big wicket SL wanted

Senanayake strikes after building a lot of pressure, het gets Nasir. It was a conventional and flighted offspinner outside off, Nasir stepped forward to drive and handed an edge to Mathews to first slip
oh and one more, now we know why the short leg fielder was there! Mahmudullah played the ball with the turn to the leg side and it went straight to Priyanjan at short leg, he's gone for a duck
oh he has handed it straight to point! Got more room to free his arms outside off, cut it straight into the hands of Dilshan as he failed to find the gap this time

notes: Sri Lanka innings
Rain: Sri Lanka - 0/0
Powerplay 1: Overs 0.1 - 9.0 (Mandatory - 39 runs, 2 wickets)
Sri Lanka: 50 runs in 11.3 overs (69 balls), Extras 5
Drinks: Sri Lanka - 52/4 in 12.0 overs (LD Chandimal 10)
Sri Lanka: 100 runs in 25.4 overs (154 balls), Extras 6
9th Wicket: 50 runs in 40 balls (NLTC Perera 35, SMSM Senanayake 18, Ex 1)
Drinks: Sri Lanka - 126/8 in 29.0 overs (NLTC Perera 37, SMSM Senanayake 22)
NLTC Perera: 50 off 40 balls (2 x 4, 4 x 6)
Sri Lanka: 150 runs in 36.1 overs (217 balls), Extras 9
Powerplay 2: Overs 36.1 - 40.0 (Batting side - 31 runs, 1 wicket)
Innings Break: Sri Lanka - 180/10 in 40.0 overs (NLTC Perera 80)
Bangladesh innings
Powerplay 1: Overs 0.1 - 9.0 (Mandatory - 41 runs, 1 wicket)
Bangladesh: 50 runs in 10.4 overs (65 balls), Extras 3
2nd Wicket: 50 runs in 63 balls (Shamsur Rahman 18, Mominul Haque 30, Ex 3)
Drinks: Bangladesh - 67/1 in 13.0 overs (Shamsur Rahman 21, Mominul Haque 43)
Bangladesh: 100 runs in 16.5 overs (102 balls), Extras 3
Shamsur Rahman: 50 off 43 balls (3 x 4, 3 x 6)
Drinks: Bangladesh - 126/4 in 26.0 overs (Mushfiqur Rahim 7, Nasir Hossain 7)
Bangladesh: 150 runs in 32.3 overs (196 balls), Extras 5
Powerplay 2: Overs 36.1 - 40.0 (Batting side - 5 runs, 2 wickets)

milestones.description: Shakib has scored 30 fifty-plus scores in ODIs, the most for BAN breaking Tamim Iqbal's record

stories.title: Sri Lanka fight back to win from 67 for 8
stories.subTitle: Bangladesh v Sri Lanka, 1st ODI, Mirpur
stories.seoTitle: Sri Lanka fight back to win from 67 for 8
stories.summary: Two spectacular batting collapses adorned the first ODI, in which Sri Lanka fought back first with the bat and then with the ball to take a tense victory

stories.title: Handling big moments will be the key - Mathews
stories.subTitle: Bangladesh v Sri Lanka, 1st ODI, Mirpur
stories.seoTitle: Handling big moments will be the key - Angelo Mathews
stories.summary: Sri Lanka captain Angelo Mathews has said, ahead of the first ODI against Bangladesh in Mirpur, handling the big moments will be key for both sides

stories.title: We can beat any team at home - Mushfiqur
stories.subTitle: Bangladesh v Sri Lanka, 1st ODI, Dhaka
stories.seoTitle: We can beat any team at home - Mushfiqur Rahim
stories.summary: Bangladesh have not lost a bilateral ODI series at home since 2011, and captain Mushfiqur Rahim believes that the trend can continue in the three-match series against Sri Lanka
